result.execSummary:
The defendant Larry Lee Linde was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Shall pay costs within 60 days or set payment plan with Clerk of Courts.

Shall serve 4 months DCJ w/h&t commencing forthwith
Concurrent with: to any sentence(s) currently imposed; with work release and transfer privileges

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Defendant Larry Lee Linde in custody via video with attorney Greg E. Vollan (may appoint).  James T. Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges and penalties. Court finds probable cause. Def. stands mute; State heard on bond: $10,000 cash; also arrested for RCS 9th that will be charged out later, Def. is on PO hold, on supervision for OWI8th; RD 4/27/15 at 2:30pm & JT 6/9/15 at 8:30am in Br. 2; Court sets $5,000 CASH Bond with conditions: Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.  Restrictions on travel: May not leave the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle without permission from this Court.
